DOC.brief_title: Diet Oil Induced Stimulation of GLP-1
DOC.detailed_description: Activation of G protein-coupled receptor GPR119 stimulates glucagon-like peptide-1 (GLP-1)release from the intestinal L-cells. Previously, administration of 2-oleyl-glycerol (2-OG) to humans significantly increased plasma GLP-1. In the present study we want to test the effect in patients with type 2 diabetes. The hypothesis is that we will expect to find a significant increased plasma GLP-1 following a meal containing of 2-OG when compared to meals containing of olive oil or carbohydrates alone. The aim of the study is to elucidate the effect of 2-OG, 'diet oil' on GLP-1 secretion in patients with type 2 diabetes and to explain the mechanism behind the known stimulation of GLP-1 release by dietary fat.
DOC.criteria: Patients with type 2 diabetes mellitus according to the WHO criteria caucasians age above 18 years BMI 2030 kidney disease liver disease retinopathy anaemia use of insulin use of GLP1 analogues use of DPP4 inhibitors
